metadata.title: CVE-2019-11027 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Ruby OpenID (aka ruby-openid) through 2.8.0 has a remotely exploitableflaw. This library is used by Rails web applications to integrate withOpenID Providers. Severity can range from medium to critical, depending onhow a web application developer chose to employ the ruby-openid library.Developers who based their OpenID integration heavily on the "example app"provided by the project are at highest risk.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11027` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-openid - 2.9.2debian-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-openid package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.2debian-1').
